intro: Calyptrosciadium bungei, commonly known as the Bunge's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops like cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and capsule fruits that contain several seeds. It typically grows in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
